info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 459 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jemez Pueblo, or 22 miles north of Bernalillo, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jemez Springs, San Ysidro, Zia Pueblo, Jemez Pueblo, Cochiti Lake, Ponderosa, and the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. This includes Highway 550 between Mile Markers 14 and 19, and between Mile Markers 23 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
